meanings.definition: Hypocritical and sanctimonious talk, typically of a moral, religious, or political nature.
meanings.sent1: The politician's speech was full of cant, pretending to care about the people.
meanings.sent2: I'm tired of hearing all the cant from those who claim to be perfect.
meanings.sent3: The cant from the gossiping ladies was so exaggerated, it sounded like a play!
meanings.sent4: Her cant about honesty was like a mask hiding her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The cant of the preacher echoed through the church, but his actions spoke louder.

meanings.sent1: The cant of the road made it difficult to ride a bike uphill.
meanings.sent2: Be careful on the cant of the hill, it's easy to slip.
meanings.sent3: The cant of the bookshelf made all the books slide to one side!
meanings.sent4: The cant of the tower gave it a leaning appearance against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cant of the ship's deck added to the excitement of the stormy sea.

meanings.definition: A particular jargon of a certain group or profession.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the cant of lawyers can be challenging for non-lawyers.
meanings.sent2: The cant of medical professionals is filled with complex terms.
meanings.sent3: The cant of chefs discussing recipes sounded like a secret code!
meanings.sent4: The cant of computer programmers is like a language of its own.
meanings.sent5: Learning the cant of musicians opened up a whole new world of terminology.
